Reviews.Title: “Good....”
Reviews.Author: Farleigh
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a 3 dot rating as it is very clean, comfortable and a good average hotel being good value for money. However, I added the extra dot because they have a shuttle that basically takes you anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel, which is wonderful! You just let them know what time you need it and they provide it. The location was perfect for us as we were visiting family, but for those who want to shop, the Dadeland Mall is across the road and many other shops and restaurants very close by. Check in and check out is incredibly slow as they only seem to have 1 person on duty most of the time and that one person seems to have to answer the phone, deal with guests and do everything. The rooms are clean and comfortable - free wifi throughout the hotel which is a definite bonus. Bathrooms are basic but clean. Shower just a trickle of water that takes a long time to warm up but to be honest, for the price we paid, we didn't have great expectations. Breakfast was very pleasant and totally adequate for our needs. One word of warning, however....we had a prepaid voucher for our stay that included breakfast. When we had breakfast on the first morning, we were billed for it. On querying this with reception, we apparently should have been given breakfast vouchers . This breakfast appeared on the bill at the end of our stay. They did refund it immediately, but to save the hassle, make sure you get your breakfast vouchers when you check in as you do need them to get your free breakfast. All in all a very pleasant stay, and at such good value, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Miami area”
Reviews.Author: Scottson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo was a welcome change. The check-in process was so smooth and efficient, that I was unaware that I was checked in so quickly. Truly no hassles at all. The room was very comfortable, spacious and clean. The amenities were First Class and the bed was so cozy that we had a hard time waking up. It was very quiet, I barely saw any other guests. I was very pleased with my hotel stay and would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Miami area. While it is not located in the Downtown area, it is not very far from everything and the parking is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Stop”
Reviews.Author: rogersowerby
Reviews.Content: Visiting friends in Kendal Fla. we chose the Indigo sight inseen. What a pleasant surprise! The check in staff were so helpful and gave us excellent advice on local restaurants etc.The rooms (2) were wonderfully clean and modern and the beds were terrific. Also the chap at the downstairs bar was so pleasant and even offered to carry our coffee outside to the terrace..We are going back this week and look forward to our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Compliment”
Reviews.Author: jbnab2
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to let you all know about a wonderful employee we encountered on two different trips to the Miami Dadeland Indigo Hotel. "Lianet" was absolutely by far the best encounter we have had with a hotel's front desk employee. She was most professional, kind, extremely helpful and above all "GENUINE"! I wish every employee at other hotels were the same. I hope that this chain understands her contribution as she is the first impression we receive entering your hotel. We hope to return to this location as often as possible.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mamita3
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a five night stay. the place was clean.the staff was nice and the beds were super confortable. We were very pleased, we ordered breakfest twice and it was good and fast and there is also a starbucks and cuban bakery across the street. I also liked that the rooms had no carpet but some sort of wood paneling it's so much cleaner and alergy friendly. would definatly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was a bit sketchy as the appearance of the building wasn't quite what I expected I guess (not that it's different from their online picture but it actually looked older). At check-in the front desk person wasn't all that friendly but they allowed us to check in early so that didn't quite bother us since everyone else particularly their driver and the night shift front desk person were really great. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean and well equipped. They are located walking distance from Dadeland mall but if you're lazy like me they had an efficient pick up service which dropped us off and picked us back up. Overall it may not be the Ritz but for the price you pay you get value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: simone1852
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived to the minute we checked out, this hotel's staff was more than coridal and professional. They were outgoing and friendly. As we walked down the hall, staff at all levels said hello, good morning, how are you. The room was squeaky clean, the bed mattress, pillows and linens were soft and comfy. Slipping into bed at night was like being in a spa. The decor was tropical but tasteful. Our room was ample for two people, plenty of space for elecronics and all the "stuff" you bring with you. The walk in shower comfortably large, although the water pressure was a bit low, even from the adustable shower head. I would definitely stay here again with no hesitation. We were traveling for the purpose of a three day conference, and didn't receive any less outstanding service based on the "event" rate that we received.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience in Indigo hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnenriadekock
Reviews.Content: Our room was good but not spacious. We had two beds and a chair and not a bench at the end of the bed. The beds were very good and also the bedlinnen. Happy with the very big walkin shower! The room was complete but We missed the bottle of water when we arrived ! After a long intercontinental flight people need WATER and in nearly all hotels is in the room a complimentary bottle of water! We missed that in this hotel. Breakfast service was very good and friendly. By the way we had no advantage of our platinum membership. Nevertheless we probably will come back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Marek M
Reviews.Content: + Excellent breakfast, very comfortable bed, overally a great stay. - It's nice to have starbucks coffee in the room but it would be even better to have a choice of tea.

Reviews.Title: “good experience, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Grimy G
Reviews.Content: Spacious clean rooms, the breakfast was excellent! It is in a good area near Dadeland shopping mall. Staff was helpful, courteous and accommodating. The walls are thin and if you have the misfortune of being close to the ice machine on the second floor, you won't fall asleep. We complained and the very helpful front desk staff moved us to another room. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgina T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and have nothing but good things to relate. The staff is extremely accomodating and upon request placed refrigerators in both of our rooms (we traveled with friends). The rooms were plently large enough, the a.c. system worked v. well and the breakfast (I had the yogourt) was excellent. You will not be disappointed if you book here.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in average neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: Little stands out about this hotel. It is in a rather old building and smells a bit musty. The rooms are small. The bathrooms are even smaller. The wood floors and tvs are nice, but do not make up for other deficiencies in this hotel. Cleanliness was average. It is in a good area of Miami near Dadeland mall but is not one of Miami's more appealing neighborhoods. The beds were fine. The shower had good water pressure, and there were nice Aveda products in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Never Changed the Sheets”
Reviews.Author: Kitty S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there 4 days/3 nights in late November of 2011, few days before Thanksgiving. Upon checking in, I noticed a black stain on my pillow case. I mentioned it to my boyfriend, and we assumed it was a stain that didn't come out during the wash. Next day, after having specifically requested the room to be made and sheets/towels to be changed (because we were in and out of the room and had wanted it done while we were gone), we came back to the room to find the same pillow case with the stain on the bed. I then lifted up the comforter and found hair still on the sheet. We called the front desk (Chris) and complained. Because it was late at night, he was the only staff on duty, besides security, he offered to let us have another room. We went up to check the cleanliness of the new room, with the security, and found the same exact problem. The sheet in the new room had hair and stain on it as well; they were never changed from the last occupancy. We then went back down, and that's when Chris told us that we were the 3rd complaint of the night. Other people noticed the dirty sheets/rooms as well! Because it was so late at night, we compromised by accepting fresh sheets from the dryer from Chris (and made the bed ourselves) and he comped the night, promising us the manager (Rick) will call us the next day. The manager never called, and the sheets never changed. If Hotel Indigo doesn't clean the room when there are guests and doesn't clean the room when they leave, when are the rooms ever cleaned? We will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, PET FRIENDLY and reasonable priced”
Reviews.Author: Beckah K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and the location was great! I travel with 2 small dogs and the staff was very accommodating to our "children" and the pet fee was very reasonable. There is an area to walk the dogs which was "walled in" making it easy to walk them without fear of vehicle traffic or bothering other guests. The room was a bit small and while it was nice to have a couch/sitting area and a desk the room would have been less cramped without it. It was an old hotel that was recently updated so there were some things in the room that were characteristic of an old motel, but nothing was in really bad shape, just slightly outdated. The staff was GREAT! I even got a jump from one of the staff members when on the last day of our stay I had a dead car battery. I thought they would say to call AAA but NOPE, they were more than happy to help. My only complaint was the lack of a refrigerator (which for me is big since I am on a restricted diet) which I requested prior to check in and was not in the room when we got there to check in late at night. When I requested it the next morning they did not have any left. Luckily we brought a cooler and the ice machines were kept fully stocked. If I need a room in Miami again, this would be a place we will probably stay. The location is right near our family and friends homes so it was PERFECT! And they welcome our furry kids which was AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting food and decor, but basic flaws hurt the experience”
Reviews.Author: schmitty233
Reviews.Content: I stayed down at the property a couple of weeks ago on a two day business trip. The location seemed really good, easily accessible, parking close to the building, near shops\restaurants, and the decor is modern. It's a pretty small hotel and did seem like it was remodeled from an older place. At night around Christmastime with the lights on the palm trees surrounding the place it looked really cool too. The front desk staff was really outgoing and helpful and so was the bar\restaurant attendant. And we were given vouchers for free breakfast in the lobby restaurant, which was small but had* excellent* food. All of this made a pretty good impression on me at first. But unfortunately, the property had some basic problems which ruined it for me as a business traveler, and probably were due to the fact that renovated or not, the building was older. The windows and walls of the place are incredibly thin. Every bit of traffic noise from the outside could be heard, and at 3:30AM while I was trying to rest up for my business meetings the next day I was awoken by the clearly heard and loud sounds of an amorous couple next door, and similarly had been kept away the night before until 10:30-11 by the room on the other side - just playing their clock radio loudly. The wireless internet was so slow as to be almost unusable, and had I not had a backup broadband LTE card to connect through, I would have been unable to work in the room. So for those reasons alone, I don't recommend it highly. I'd also mention that parts of the room itself were in poor condition, some of the trim, and the fake wood floor planks actually had large gaps (1/4"+) between ends\edges of the planks, really poor.. TV/Cable older, not great pic quality. There is no tub in the room, only a shower if that's a concern. If they soundproofed the walls and windows and fixed up the interiors a bit, it would go a long way to helping improve the experience.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do”
Reviews.Author: Homewardbound12
Reviews.Content: Not exactly what we expected since we had stayed at a really nice Hotel Indigo the night prior. Our room was not clean to our standard and the rooms are very small. The hotel appeared to be an old hotel of another brand which they had tried to remodel. The beds were comfortable and location of the hotel is not so bad. When we were trying to leave the next morning, the maid opened our door without knocking and asked if we were ready to leave. She did not speak English and didn't understand that we were still getting ready; very annoying. We do not plan to stay at this hotel again. There are other, nice hotels in the area I would recommend before going to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable to stay with pets”
Reviews.Author: geomate
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother-in-law and I booked a room for 3 nights over Christmas at the Holiday Inn on US 1 just north of the Indigo. Upon reserving with the very gracious reservations staff, I asked whether they accepted pets at the Holiday Inn and she tried to refer me to the Indigo. We were going to leave the pets at my sister's house while we retired to the hotel so I booked the Holiday Inn. Well, in families things change and we were stuck at the last minute - after checking in and putting our bags in the Holiday Inn - and my sister didn't want the pets at her house without us around. As a last resort (I was going to break the rules and chance a $250 pet fee at the H.I.), I called the Indigo and asked if they had a room available - the lady was going to fix the whole situation on the phone and transfer us if I had not already checked in. Instead I called the H.I. and the manager Manuel Castillo was AWESOME and allowed us to break that reservation penalty free because I promised to book the same room nights at the Indigo while standing in front of him. HUGE relief to solve this mini-crisis. The Indigo was very accommodating to pets and us and the room was just great. There is an awesome Brazilian Italian restaurant across the street that serves up a great pizza and I just can't say enough good things about the staff at the Indigo. Thank you all - I am posting this review on both hotels so they know they are appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: 2angel
Reviews.Content: This little gem was great! We stay from Nov 13 through the 15. The staff was off the chain they were great! Very very clean and upscale hotel very morden. The room was large and clean I just didnt like the wood floors they were cold. So I had to keep on socks when up and about in the room. Floors are beautiful through. I really enjoyed the hotel . They have a small place to eat, entertain and have drinks if you want too. I would book again. So much to do in the area lots of Malls and food places love it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo Dadeland - Ok”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn1313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business related travel November 9-11 2011 and November 13 -18 2011. The rooms were very nice and modern, the hotel gym is excellent, the bar is also excellent with great bartenders / servers and many of the front desk staff are wonderfully personable. The shuttle service is nice, but expect to wait if you need it. Due to the busy location, it isn't always on time. However, what made me switch hotels for business travel was that housekeeping left the door to my room open one day. The hotel building is older and my room door did not close all the way on it's own. I brought this up to management and only received a very perfunctory apology. The other thing that was irritating was that they were supposed to bill my contract house for the stay, but billed me instead. When my manager called, they told him they billed him and only had my credit card for incidentals. However, he didn't have any charges for me so he and I just worked it out on our own. This is what I'm basing my low service rating on. Also, locals told me the actual hotel building has a reputation. It used to be a pay by the hour hotel. It is also very close to the 826 so depending on the room you get, you may get a lot of highway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique experience at chain price”
Reviews.Author: thereareplaces
Reviews.Content: We have relatives in Miami and visit each year for a week. For the last three years we have stayed at the Hotel Indigo at Dadeland and each year the experience has improved. The staff remains the same each year so we know we are getting experienced support. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the small restaurant is a surprisingly full-service kitchen.The workout facility offers aerobic machines and a terrific full-service tower weight set. If you are a cat lover, take the back stairs to exit the building and visit the hotel cat that resides on the staff patio in back. It says a lot about the staff that they take care of a pet just like a household would. A peaceful respite in a town that is otherwise too crowded and too noisy for this Midwesterner.

Reviews.Title: “noisy staff woke me up every day”
Reviews.Author: wayway2muchtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. The pictures are somewhat deceiving, as the hotel is much older than it looks in the pics. The walls are thin and if you have the misfortune of being across from a housekeeping station, you'll awaken to loud talking (yelling almost). I complained but it continued. I asked to be moved and it never happened. I'm a platinum Priority Club Member. Attention management: Instruct your staff to have a little more regard for the peace and quiet of your customers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clh1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 4th Nov to â€“ 11th Nov 2011. On arrival it was lovely. Staff were great, the ladies behind reception were really helpful and nice, and a lovely lady behind the bar with dark hair was brilliant. She gave us lots of advice on places to go and what was in the area etc. The hotel itself is in a really nice area, would have found it a bit difficult to get around if we hadnâ€™t have hired a car, although there is a tram thing opposite the hotel. There are a few shops, and a big shopping mall within walking distance. We went to coconut grove most days and thought that was a really nice area too. The hotel was really clean and tidy, maids were in every day to clean the room and the beds were very spacious and comfortable. The only issue we had, was that there was 4 of us in a room (3 men and 1 woman) and ultimately we did pay for another room, (the hotel did do a discounted rate for us though) just because we were getting on top of each other and it wasnâ€™t practical for us. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel without a doubt. Service was brilliant on all parts, the maids were great and front desk were extremely efficient. The only thing I would comment on would be location â€“ but thatâ€™s not a fault really. If I was going to return to Miami, I would most probably stay on the beach. But that is only because our return taxi fare to Collins ave for a night out was $120! Other than that â€“ there is nothing I could fault this hotel on. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: threedandj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a gem in the Miami dadeland area. Centrall located, it is easy access to restaurants and other points of interest. The beds are outstanding, the staff very friendly, and a starbucks walking distance. I highly recommend the Indigo for business or holiday travel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: athena-fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo Miami Dadeland because we were participating in an athletic event in the area that had an early start. The room was very reasonably priced and the hotel offers free off-street parking. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We asked for recommendations for restaurants we could reach on foot and they gave us several options. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated in a contemporary style. We had a walk-in shower rather than a shower/tub combo. Since we had an early start we stayed in for the evening and thought the hotel had a good selection of TV channels. It seems like they have more channels than most hotels. The bedside alarm clock had a CD player, no iPod dock. The bed was very comfortable. The only things about this hotel that sort of bothered us (and I question whether they're worth mentioning) were that some of the elevator lobby areas showed some wear, the room was way too cool when we arrived, and walking from the hotel was a bit harrowing because the streets around it are not friendly to pedestrian traffic--narrow sidewalks, limited crosswalks, extremely heavy and fast traffic. Of course, the hotel can't control the traffic, but if you want to walk to the mall or to restaurants, at least you know what to expect. All in all, though, we were pleased with Hotel Indigo Dadeland and will likely book there again for next year's event.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Bronco09
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a shopping trip so the location was perfect as it was close to Dadeland Mall and other shops as well as I-826 so you can get quickly to other locations as well. As far as I am aware they also offer shuttle service to the mall which may be helpful for some. The room was nice and seemed clean. Only disadvantage is that the front entrance is oddly located and the parking around it is a bit cramped, especially if you drive a larger vehicle. I would not recommend this hotel if you want a relaxing vacation, but it is very convenient for shopping and business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, busy location”
Reviews.Author: Karenh614
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a trip to my Aunt's funeral. Staff excellent! Room nice. Pool is on highway and not relaxing. This hotel served the purpose for this trip but I would not want to sty there often. It was clean, it was personable, it was comfortable but it is located at a very busy intersection and there is no escaping that. Rooms are quiet despite location.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, super beds, good value”
Reviews.Author: lakemary1204
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in Dadeland, south of the University of Miami, reasonably small, extremely clean. The check-in was friendly and efficient, the rooms were roomy. The beds were very nice, comfortable, the high-off-the floor type. Given the low price, less than $130 including all tourist taxes, a work out room and a down to earth coffee bar with reasonable food choices, definitely should be considered instead of nearby Marriott or Courtyard, or any of the more expensive downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: keisha73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo Miami Dadeland was perfect for my needs. It was modern and chic and warm with bright vibrant colours. I loved it. The young lady that checked me in was so energetic and helpful. She is perfect in this job. Plus she informed me of the types of rooms she had available/clean similar to the room I booked online. Also told me about the hotel's area shuttle would take me to the mall and pick me up. Shuttle was available on the hour each hour. She identified me as a Priority Rewards Member and as such offered me a fortune cookie to open. After opening it I saw that I was the winner of 1,000 bonus points and 2 free drinks at the bar. So I redeemed for one drink a - a mojito which I wanted as take out so the bartender offered to bring it up to my room. A large plastic cup of mojito with a straw... I appreciated. Overall a great stay. Wish I had been able to stay to use the hotel pool, business centre, restaurant and in-room dining. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: edieungar
Reviews.Content: I spent almost two weeks here while my mother recovered from a fall and surgery. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, kind, generous and caring during our stay. They gave us great ideas for restaurants, tourist attractions (near the hospital) that were age appropriate for my kids and were very solicitous regarding our needs. Honestly, THE BEST HOTEL STAFF I've ever encountered!!!!! A small, almost boutique style hotel with a very big heart!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good for the price”
Reviews.Author: act1013
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Hotel is always clean and good for the price. Beds are comfortable. Wood floors are a great plus. Staff is always friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Best kep secret for a romantic/ Quiet Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: ricanchica1174
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased to have stayed at the Hotel Indigo. After searching online for a last-minute evening alone without the kids. I came across a coupon as a walk-in on Roomsavers.com. An Amazing DEAL. I would rate this hotel as a 4 star. The enviroment was smoke-free, friendly staff, updated/ modern design. Rooms are just perfect for 2. They also has FREE parking. I would advise, if you want a quiet evening alone without the loud noise of airplanes or traffic and stay on a budget with the luxury of being pampered. Check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “second to none!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickNY2011
Reviews.Content: Rick and his staff over at The Hotel Indigo are out of this world. They made our stay in Miami simply amazing. This upscale, modern hotel is wonderful, right from the minute you walk in the lobby where you are greeted with a smile, until you lay your head down on a soft pillow on the sturdy beds. Hotel Indigo is a vacationers dream come true. I can't wait to come back soon... kudos to Rick and his staff!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tparchi
Reviews.Content: we are a family with 2 children, ages 14 and 11. we spent 3 nights at the indigo hotel a few days ago. staff very kind and helpfull, rooms very modern and comfortable, great pool, nice lobby and restaurant (starbucks coffee). the only fault we found is the location: to get to downtown miami or to miami beach is a long and congested way (u.s 1). no highway. takes about 35-50 minutes, depends on the hour. but otherwise, we enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great value”
Reviews.Author: mfernandez86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights, Friday-Sunday. I am a college student with a lot of stress and my ac had broken at home, so I decided to rent a hotel for myself to relax and clear my mind. The hotel was in a great location, it was very pretty and nicely decorated, the rooms were awesome and so were the bathrooms. I was VERY impressed at the size of the room. Thank God for no carpets! The staff was super sweet and friendly. (Specially, this one young lady, she's skinny with long curly hair, what a sweet girl!) The beds and pillows were super comfy. The only thing I would recommend is better cleaning. Although everything was super clean, there were little things here and there that caught my attention. The coffee machine was missing a piece and it was a little dirty, the shower had some hair in it, and when the mirror fogged up you can see that there was something written on it. Another thing is the smell when you walked in the lobby, they do have a cafeteria maybe thats why the smell was so pungent. Overall, I would defintely recommend it, I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: lizzy1417
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to visit the University of Miami for about 5 days. Not only do they have a free shuttle within 3 miles, but they will also drop you off and pick you up the 4 or 5 miles to the university campus. It would have been nice if they had a shuttle to the airport as well as its about a 35 dollar cab ride each way. When we first arrived we were about 3 hours ahead of check-in time, and within minutes they had a room already prepared for us. We got a room with a king sized bed and sofa, and the bed was sooo comfortable. There was a moderately large flat screen TV in front of it which was pretty awesome too. We asked for the complimentary microwave and refrigerator and received them both within the next couple of hours. The staff members were very friendly and consistent, especially the waiters/bartenders and shuttle drivers. The restaurant/bar wasn't too spacious but was very convenient, attractive and never crowded- not to mention their french toast was awesome and they have a Starbucks. The only thing that was a little annoying was that our room keys kept demagnetizing. I'm not sure why this kept happening, but they always helped us out fixing them quickly. At the end of the day, it was a great hotel, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: mlfd
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet, great value for the location, shuttle service to mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashley010
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. loved the free shuttle to the mall .Friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “A very good bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: Lyrad1949
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to stay for our trip to Miami mainly because of the reviews we read. We were not disappointed when we arrived. Its clean, friendly , and great value, and nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely an awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sikosrki
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 06 nights at Indigo, besides the great location, the rooms are comfortable, clean and dont have carpet. The hotel staff was great, mainly Fernando, very nice and considerate. The option of driking a starbucks coffee at the hotel and very practical for those who want to enjoy the day in Miami without having to waste time. We indicate with certainty to all who avaluate this hotel, we had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to Stay at Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: worldpainter
Reviews.Content: I visited the Miami Kendall area for medical reasons, and needed to be near the Baptist Hospital. I researched many hotels in the area. Hotel Indigo was a bit more expensive, but it offered a free shuttle within 3 mi of the Hotel. It was near a mall, and shopping directly across the street so this seemed a good fit for visiting without a car. I traveled with my daughter and we had a King size bed and sleeper sofa. We found the front desk workers to be very polite and attempted to be as helpful as possible! We found the room very clean. The air conditioner worked well, though the first night we did not know how to adjust it (we arrived late at night) It was quite noisy, but after a while we didn't notice it. There is free wifi in the room and a nice TV. We found the bar/restaraunt to be very small and there was no room service menu in the room. I had to go down 5 floors to get a menu to order room service. But the food was hot and very good, the night we needed to eat in. It was very convenient to be able to walk across the street to a real Starbucks (the Starbucks in the Hotel is not really a Starbucks). There is also a very wonderful Bakery across the street. It has lovely international and tropical sweet pastries, savory pastries, desserts, sandwiches, and breads! There were a couple of hitches. Though I made arrangements ahead of time at the front desk every time we needed the shuttle, there always seemed to be some mix up. One time I almost missed my doctors appointment and the driver seemed very irritated with us. Another time, he completely missed the resteraunt (even though we saw it and gave him the address) and it ended up taking an extra half hour because of turning around and traffic. So, my advice is to be really pushy about the shuttle. Well... very clear over and over... clear to the front desk with time and address... then confirm with the driver as you get on the shuttle, then speak up if he's going the wrong way!!! The pool was small but nice - though the chair only allows one to lay on their back in the sun and do not adjust.. Towels are provided in each chair. Coming from the NW, I wanted some sun so I laid on the pavement. Also, most of the pool area was shaded this time of year and I had about a 1 1/2 hr space that I could catch sun. This is not a complaint - only an observation and something for others to know. The bed was not very comfortable - we both had backaches, BUT the pillows were GREAT! Also, the towels were fabulous - thick and absorbent and smelled clean. The toiletries were very very nice and high quality. My only other complaint, is that the Hotel didn't have very good instructions or information in the rooms. There was a flip card with basic info, but no tourist info, and many things in our room we had to figure out ourselves. I like Hotels that have nice books with lots of information in them - restaraunts - shopping - hotel policies - how to work things in the room, etc etc. All and all I was very happy with my choice. It was the perfect location for what I needed and though right next to the Hwy - it was nice and quiet, peaceful and clean. And if I have to go back, I will choose this Hotel again. I hope this helps others planning a trip to the Dadeland/Kendall area of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay for a Business or Leisure Trip”
Reviews.Author: jeretired
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a "boutique" Hotel, no carpeting on the floor, hardwood throughout. Almost Spartan amenities but the most comfortable bed and great desk/cleaning help we've encountered in quite a while. They advertise "free wireless Internet" but I think I received it for a total of about three hours in three whole days. They even brought me up an ethernet cord to no avail. Location is great but the traffic from there to downtown Miami is far worse than Seattle ever thought of being. over an hour to trvel 8 miles, coming AND going to downtown! I'd definitely recommend staying here to a friend BUT would NOT recommend booking through HotWire.Com!! I found a copy of the FREE RoomSaver pamphlet at the entrance to Miami I-Hop and Dennys, etc, and could have saved over $60.00 by using them at the Horel Indigo instead of foolishly using HotWire.com. Now I know that I can go online to RoomSaver.com and "shop hotel pricing" ahead of my trip, that's what I'll do from now on!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty hotel.. only that with little problems”
Reviews.Author: ilovecupcakes14
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel after I took a trip to Key West. All of my family was there, my mom and dad, husband, and my children. One of the things I loved about this hotel was the breakfast (the french toast was splendid, my kids loved it) and the service. But this hotel had complications, first my family and I got trapped in the elevator and the staff said it was normal for the elevator to get stuck, and it was really slow too. Then the firefighters came and got us out but we lost half of the day. Then supposely the hotel doesnt let you smoke but the lobby smelled like cigarette. And I really think they should change the doors to get into the room, my three year old son hit his fingers because the doors come back to you and their really heavy. But beside that I had a nice vacation with this hotel. Hopefully you will take in consideration my problems so that I can have another pleasant vacations with you guys.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back.”
Reviews.Author: travelingteddybear
Reviews.Content: While the scenery may not be touristy or glamorous, it is overall a decent hotel. The service was good and staff was friendly. Our room was clean and evidently had gone through a renovation, which was nice. The bed and pillows were super comfy!! Free wi-fi was a big plus. It was too cold to jump in the pool (for my standards) but from what I could tell, it seemed clean and well-kept. I probably would recommend this hotel to a business traveler or local resident. There's not much going on in the area unless you're planning on shopping at Dadeland Mall. There's good nightlife (restaurants, dive bars and more shopping) in South Miami by US1 which is just a few minutes away as well. I wasn't crazy about the shampoo and conditioner though - rosemary and mint?

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: laface96
Reviews.Content: Let me first begin by stating that I only spent one night in this hotel. I simply picked it to gain more priority reward points. Once I arrived I was pleasantly surprised especially since I was unsure what to expect since I had never hear of this hotel chain before. As per the front desk this hotel was brought and remodeled 2 years ago. The hotel had a very modern feel to it from the lobby to the to the rooms. I was most impressed with the rooms. One of the walls inside the room had a floor to ceiling digitally printed image on the wallpaper of a starfish in the water (nice modern feel to go along with the "indigo" theme). The room had a new flat screen TV, plush lounge chair and very very comfortable King bed with many soft pillows. This hotel also as had a outdoor pool, exercise room, free WiFi (no login code needed), business center and 1st floor bar with hot food served. This hotel is located a block from the Dadeland Mall and across the street from Starbucks & Jamba Juice. I would definitely stay in another Hotel Indigo based upon my experence here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: princesspaty
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are horrible, the manager is racist and the morale is low. They treat their staff horribly and maybe this is why the staff is angry. I will never stay in this hotel again. The rooms are smelly and sheets were dirty. The food is all processed pre-made and just heated before serving. The food is also very over priced. The location sucks since it's far away from the beach and basically all you have is Dadeland mall around. Save your money and go somewhere else. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, comfortable rooms, Central location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Maverick182
Reviews.Content: The stay was nothing but pleasant. Very comfortable rooms, nice ambience, centrally located, reasonable priced, free parking right outside the front desk which is a rarity in Miami, good complimentary breakfast buffet menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsupilam
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great except for 2 things.......They do not have ESPN. Being a football fan, I was unable to watch Dallas play on Monday night. Also they do not have TNT...which had the Heat v celtics game. The wireless would not work at night both nights i was there, but they do have free computer access in the lobby which was a life save As a sports fan the hotel is 1 star. As a business traveler the hotel is 5 Star

Reviews.Title: “Great clean pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoMoonbeam
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like staying in pet hotels as they are not usually very nice but Hotel Indigo on Kendall in Miami was a pleasant exception. It was very clean, friendly, quiet and comfortable. The floors in our pet room were lamante wood which I thought was much better than carpet in a pet room. I was also very impressed with all the staff that all greated me in English. One of my pet peves in Miami is that the cubans address everyone in spanish first but that was not the case here and I appreciated it. The pet fee of $20 was the most reasonable compared to the other hotels in Miami that allowed pets wanted 100 bucks a night. Also one plus I enjoyed is that the water did not smell and taste of clorine. I wish I could take the bed home with me, it was very comfortable with a nice pillow top. The cons were no fridge or microwave in the room and no free breakfast. However we did have breakfast at their cafe downstairs and it was very good and reasonable. This is a very modern looking hotel. We will definitly stay here again when we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better spot”
Reviews.Author: martaTCI
Reviews.Content: Three trips in three months and all of them were spent at the Hotel Indigo while I went back and forth to the hospital. I travelled from the Turks and Caicos Islands for breast cancer treatment, doctors' appointments, tests and more tests, surgery and radiation too. My main consideration when searching for a hotel to stay at was of course proximity to the South Miami Hospital since my stays were from ten days to over two weeks at a time. I loved the looks of the rooms and of course the shuttle was key in my decision making. I booked a room with two beds because every step of the way, I had family from Canada fly down to be with me so I wouldn't be alone. The staff was friendly, courteous and always ready with a smile and a hello. The small restaurant on site was a real bonus for those days when I was too exhausted to go out and have a bite to eat. I loved the French onion soup! House keeping was generally pretty good although on one trip, our bathroom was in need of a bit of work and then also sometimes we didn't get clean glasses. Nothing too dramatic though. We had a few glitches with the shuttle...........a couple of long waits for pick ups ( I guess they forgot us) even after we made sure we called at about 10 to the hour. The shuttle would leave promptly on the hour though which was good for making sure I made my appointments in plenty of time. The drivers were great but one was overly talkative and another spoke pretty much no English. On my second trip, I found out that small fridges were available ........ this really helped as I was in the hotel for a two and a half weeks stay. It made it more convenient to put in a few items and not have to head out to find something to eat all the time. My one big disappointment with the Hotel Indigo was NO BATHTUB.............yes, I know all about water conservation coming from the Turks where we have an annual rainfall of 2 feet! I spoke to Rick, the manager and asked him to relay my suggestion to the hotel powers that be. The hotel has many guests that are in Miami for health issues and treatments and I suggested that they could perhaps make over a few rooms and put the bathtubs back in. I had bi lateral lumpectomies so a bath tub would have made things easier for me after the surgery. My last week at the hotel included radiation. I had a balloon catheter inserted into the cavity where the tumor had been removed. This was filled with saline water and I went twice a day for five days of radiation treatments. So for a week, I was not allowed to get anything wet and NO showers. With all this stress of breast cancer going on in my life, a bath tub and a long soak with a good book would have been a way to relax and forget things for a short while. Oh yes..........the shopping. It doesn't get any better or more convenient than this. The shuttle took us everywhere. Dadeland Mall, Sunset Mall, The Falls, Target, K Mart and Publix etc. Thanks everyone..........I do hope I don't have to return in the future but if I do, I'll be staying with you! Cheers, Martha Morton

Reviews.Title: “a great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: SRQgirl
Reviews.Content: Just about everything was wonderful about our stay at the Hotel Indigo near Dadeland. The staff was extremely accomodating in every aspect. From the check in to the check out we were always treated like VIPs. This is a former Ramada Inn that I remember was there 30 years ago. They have updated, upgraded and improved all the rooms to Hotel Indigo standards. Nice bath products, coffeemaker and a very comfortable bed. The A/C and temperature controls were great. Food in the restaurant was a pleasant surprise. Edison and his staff were a great way to start the day...orenjoy a cocktail. Free parking is also nice.. The only negative is the ingress/egress on to SW 77th Ave. from Kendall Drive. Short driveway to get to the hotel...limited visibility. Would highly recommedn this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conection to Miami Malls and Key West”
Reviews.Author: apizzolato
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a finding in South Miami. Good access to US1, to Dadeland Mall, CompUSA is walking distance. Rooms are new and very confortable. Free Wifi inside rooms and free bussiness center as well as free parking. We stayed in 4 in a 2 double beds bedroom, I recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Comfortable, and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: travelingperpetually
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night en route to the Keys from the Fort Lauderdale/Miami area. Turned out to be a great choice. We had a king sized corner room, which felt a little cozy, but comfortable nonetheless. It did smell a little funny upon entering (like mildew'y), but once we turned on the A/C you couldn't notice. The shower area was a little dirtier than I would have liked, but that's why you travel with flip flops, right? This hotel offers free high speed internet. Some other notable features: the hotel has a gym/fitness area and an outdoor pool. In the morning, I took advantage of the complimentary continental breakfast, which was better than I had anticipated. All in all, I was very happy with my stay here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Miami for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our favourite in Miami when we want to shop. Dadeland Mall is in walking distance and the hotel has a shuttle anyway. Rooms are quite big and the staff is extremely helpful. Access to the highway is a half a block away. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel038
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stay at the Hotel Indigo. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet. Comfortable beds. The hotel is very easy to find... right off of US1 and several other main roads. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Should you need to use the computers in the business center, just know that the internet connection is VERY slow!

Reviews.Title: “Unique "boutique" hotel that was inviting, modern and a great price”
Reviews.Author: ErinBearin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while moving into a condo nearby. The colors and atmosphere were very modern and comfy. The bed was amazing (I wanted to buy the mattress) and I loved the duvet and fluffy pillows. The lobby pumps out a sweet smelling fragrance, and the cool blues and lime hues were very relaxing. The bathroom is set up like a spa with a bench in the stone tiled shower, clear glass shower door, and great hair/body products (all organic of course). Did not offer free breakfast, which was disappointing. Did allow pets and with the wooden floors it felt very clean in the rooms. Not recommended if you want anything near the beach, but a great alternative to more mainstream Marriott and Hampton Inn options

Reviews.Title: “Far from South Beach but Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: wcasey10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Indigo for two nights in the month of March and what a wonderful stay that was! First the buliding looks like it use to be like a Holiday Inn Express so your thoughts coming to the bldg may not be postive but dont be fooled. The decor in the lobby is up to date and the cafe is a nice place for a snack. (Just an fyi the cafe doubles as the restaurant). My room was a handicapped room but was very spacious. I was disappointed about the smell in the bathroom.. It did have a slight smell but i didnt complain because it was a handicapped room. The pictures online are exactly what the room looks like but with more space! The bed was sooooo comfy, I actually thinking about purchasing a bed just like it. I didnt hear any neighbors during my stay there. Now if your planning on being in South Beach a lot, just note the hotel is about a 25 min drive away from Miami Beach. When traveling to the hotel note to take 836 (dolphin hwy) South to get the hotel and take the 88th street exit. And you will be right next to the hotel. The area was great too! There was a wonderful mall down the street from the hotel. They have a Macys and Saks Fifth Ave. with other luxury stores inside.. The stay was wonderful and I will def be back!

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: susub
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Miami on personal business for 12 days - a long time to stay in a hotel. I chose Hotel Indigo for its location and reasonable rates (I booked flight and hotel combo thru Travelocity). I have many kudos for this hotel. First off, the staff from the front desk to the restaurant to housekeeping to maintenance/shuttle drivers were friendly and eager to help me - at all times. I used the hotel's shuttle quite a bit as I needed on almost a daily basis to go to an address 2 1/2 miles away, and the hotel offers free shuttle service to a maximum distance of 3 miles. One time the hotel's phone system was down, and I had the manager's, Rick, card with his cell phone number on it so I called him to tell him I needed the shuttle to pick me up. I was apologetic that I intruded that way but Rick was very, very pleasant, told me he would have the shuttle come get me right away and even called me when the shuttle was on its way. Which is another reason I liked Hotel Indigo. It is a manageable size so you get personal service and attention to detail. It truly was like a home away from home during my stay. The rooms are clean enough with comfy beds, the breakfasts were tasty, the exercise room is adequate. The hotel is also close to plenty of good restaurants. Although my first impressions of the hotel were more along the lines of this hotel will be adequate, I grew to love this place. I will definitely stay here again when I need to spend time in that area again!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hotel Indigo standards”
Reviews.Author: Weezy341
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed two nights at the Sarasota Hotel Indigo. Absolutely Fabulous. Miami-Dade. Not so much. Dear Manager Rick. You need to inspect the rooms yourself and speak to housekeeping again. I've changed rooms only to find both showers are dirty. Floors in the lobby and elevator are dirty. I seek out these hotels and this one was a disappointment. The exception to this stay was the efficiency of the lone desk clerk. She multi-tasked a lobby full of late check ins with grace. Pretty impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: MMMMmmm_or_not
Reviews.Content: With in walking distance of a nice mall, an Argentina Bakery, and a few other businesses. Pool was open. Staff was friendly. On the down side there was something dirty-looking in the bed the first night we got there. We followed the instructions on the "save water" brochure that is becoming common in hotels to indicate the sheets should be changed. They weren't. We asked and they did change them but we had to do a lot of explaining about why we wanted it done etc. The shower was luke warm but never got truly warm. The complimentary non-alcoholic mojitos and cookies in the lobby each day was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Boutique Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: VacayGoddess
Reviews.Content: Location is right off exit 1 or the turnpike (easy access). Clean, contemporary from the lobby to the even better room decor. The staff from front desk, cafe and housekeeping were very courteous and accomodating. Front desk helpful for directions and suggestions. Bakery, jamba juice and starbucks are directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations for the anticipated boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper10
Reviews.Content: Looking at this hotel from the outside, I wouldn't ahve exptected much. It's an older building, but good paint and parking surfaces. It's in an area near a big mall, but not with the other hotels. There is a small mall across the street (walking distance) with some orenital, itilian, stead house choices. Also a starbucks and an international bakery. The staff was very nice and answered my million questions about the area and directed me to where I need to go. Internet in the lobby and also in the room- no complaints. The work out room was medium sized, but only had three pieces of cardio equipment (all working!) and some universal gym stuff. the TV was big and it worked too. I checked out the pool, but didn't swim. Pool area and pool seemed very clean. The rooms are really different. If you look at the wibsite for this hotel, it is exactly as pictured. Floors are hard surface (wood laminate) and area rugs or throw rugs. Lamps and furnishings are very contemporary- and very comfortable. I had a fridge in my unit. The rooms were very clean, AC worked great. Colors are very unusual as well as artwork and wall murals. There is a small restaurant in the lobby, but I did not eat there. I felt very safe here (lone female traveler). I would stay again. It's very unusual in a refreshing sort of way.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Indigo Miami Dadeland
HotelInfo.Address: 7600 North Kendall Drive, Miami, FL 33156
